source:
When the site is being launched from the homescreen, you can launch it in:
Fullscreen: This will cover up the entire display of the device.
Standalone: (default) Kind of the same as Fullscreen, but only shows the top info bar of the device. (Telecom provider, time, battery etc.)
Browser: It will simply just run from the browser on your device with all the user interface elements of the browser.
Action that is triggered when a entity is created
Administer PWA and Push notification settings
Allows access to administering settings for Progressive Web App and Push notifications.
Allows access to broadcasting a push notification message to any user that has this enabled.
Choose enable to receive important updates straight away!
Configures if the site should run in Portrait (default) or Landscape mode on the device when being launched from the homescreen.
Disabling the push notifications and PWA will ensure that no user is able to configure and receive push notifications. Nor will any other Progressive Web App functions be available.
Enter the name of your website.
In order for push notifications and your Progressive Web App to work you will need to configure the settings below.
Makes the website "Installable" like an App on smartphones and enhances it with Service Workers for the use of Push Notifications and an Offline User Experience.
Provide a square (.png) image. This image serves as your icon when the user adds the website to their home screen. Minimum dimensions are 512px by 512px.
Select a background color for the launch screen. This is shown when the user opens the website from their homescreen.
Send push notifications to that have enabled notifications
Show notifications in the corner of your computer screen, even if the website is closed.
The GMP library for PHP is missing or outdated. Check the PHP GMP documentation for information on how to correct this.
The Social PWA module has been enabled.
The path '%path' has to start with a slash.
The scope for the Service Worker.
There are currently no users subscribed to receive push notifications.
These can always be disabled in Settings.
These settings have been set automatically to serve the most common use cases. Only change these settings if you know what you are doing.
This color is used to create a consistent experience in the browser when the users launch your website from their homescreen.
This is a list of users that have given permission to receive notifications.
This is the name the user will see when they add your website to their homescreen. You might want to keep this short.
This will be the message of the Push Notification.
This will be the title of the Push Notification. (Static value for now)
Used to send activity notifications by Web Push
Without VAPID keys no push notifications can be send. Turning the Social PWA module off and on again should generate new keys.
Would you like to enable push notifications?
You have denied receiving push notifications through your browser. Please reset your browser setting for receiving notifications.
You have denied receiving push notifications through your browser. Please reset your browser setting for receiving notifications.
Your browser does not support push notifications.
